The followers of the light are a secret cult whose existance remains a rumour. This cult is obssessed with gaining knowledge and secrecy. They have made a terrible pact for which they have received the prolonged life and the ability to see the future. Their agents move in the shadows to attempt to shape the future for the benefit of its members.

There are a number of quite large Dwarven conglomerate businesses, such as Iron Hill Mining, and Laibstadt Foundries, that own and operate a large number of smaller businesses. These companies are usually owned and run by particular dwarven extended families, they have their own small banks, and are their own political entities. They fund prospecting and the creation of new trade routes and industries, bribe politicians and push for legal changes. Sometimes they strong-arm smaller organizations out of business. The worst are not above arson, smuggling, bribery and other illicit activities.

Dwarves have a large number of money-lending institutions. Backing many of these is the Zwergeninvestitionen, a not-for-profit Dwarven Central Bank. This institution lends money to Dwarven money-lenders, governments and large businesses. These activities are used to fund the Dwarven Grudge Keeping arm of the organization, a band of militant bankers encharged with balancing the Book of Grudges or Grollbuch. Sins of blood are recorded in the book of grudges by Grudge Keepers and the Dwarves spend considerable effort ensuring that these debts are paid in full. Entries in the Grollbuch range from Zwerggild for the death of an individual to revenge against entire enemy nations (the largest consolidated debt in the book is owed to the Orcish Tribes). There are many copies of the Book of Grudges distributed throughout the Dwarven colonies and these are constantly being updated with entries from far off book keepers to try and keep the books consolidated.
